title: The 6 most romantic places in New England, according to Travel + Leisure
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Travel + Leisure lists Boston Public Garden as Massachusetts' most romantic spot.
Isle au Haut in Maine is praised for its seclusion and scenic beauty.
Mohegan Bluffs on Block Island offers dramatic views in Rhode Island.

title: Pickup left dangling off Zakim Bridge in early-morning crash
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A pickup truck dangled off the Zakim Bridge after swerving to avoid a disabled vehicle Thursday morning.
Massachusetts State Police responded before 5:30 a.m. with no injuries reported and called a tow rotator to secure the truck.
The right lane of I-93 northbound was closed at Exit 19 from just before 7 a.m. and reopened by 8:10 a.m.

title: 2026 Super Bowl commercials: Watch all the ads from the big game
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Ben Affleck directs Dunkin' ad with 'Friends' and 'Seinfeld' stars for 2026 Super Bowl.
Amazon Alexa, Open AI, and Oakley Meta among firms highlighting AI in Super Bowl commercials.
Celebrities like Peyton Manning and Matthew McConaughey feature in recurring Super Bowl ad roles.

title: How much does Tom Brady’s lack of support for the Patriots in Super Bowl LX bother you?
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Tom Brady, now a minority Raiders owner, won't officially support Patriots in Super Bowl LX against Seahawks.
Brady expressed a neutral stance on the Patriots game during an interview on the 'Let’s Go!' podcast.
Former teammates Vince Wilfork and others criticized Brady's lack of explicit support for his former team.

title: Hingham kids revive a lucky tradition on Patriots Way ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Hingham children revive tradition of posing under Patriots Way sign for Super Bowl LX support.
The superstition began in 2017 when a photo coincided with a Patriots Super Bowl victory.
Neighborhood gathers again, hoping photo tradition brings luck as Patriots head to Super Bowl LX.

title: 5 best new restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston (Feb. 5, 2026)
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Nohri offers Nikkei cuisine featuring handrolls and tasting menus at 5 Tyler St., Chinatown, open since January 2026.
Novo Lantern opens on 1750 Washington St., South End, serving soup dumplings and Asian-inspired dishes since January 2026.
Retro Room, a listening lounge with comfort food and cocktails, is now open at 867 Boylston St., Back Bay.

title: Super Bowl betting expected to surge as experts warn of problem gambling
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: U.S. sportsbooks expect $1.76 billion in Super Bowl LX bets, a 27% increase from last year, says American Gaming Association.
Massachusetts sports betting in December 2025 generated $98.47 million in revenue, raising $19.6 million in taxes for the state.
Problem gambling in Massachusetts rose from 20.9% to 28% among monthly gamblers between 2022 and 2024, according to a UMass study.

title: Boston police release Super Bowl safety plan, limiting traffic, parking, pedestrian access
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Boston police to enforce traffic and pedestrian restrictions around Boston University, Northeastern, and nightlife areas for Super Bowl LX.
Restrictions in Kenmore Square, Boylston, and Hemenway start after the third quarter; increased patrols near bars and residential areas.
Commissioner Cox urges public to stay alert, warns against underage drinking, and highlights cold weather safety during Super Bowl.

title: As storm cleanup lingers, City Council pushes for snow melters and dedicated ‘snow corps’
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Boston City Council advocates for snow melters and a volunteer 'snow corps' to improve storm cleanup efforts.
Boston faced transport disruptions and increased safety concerns after a late January storm deposited nearly two feet of snow.
Councilor Flynn proposes purchasing snow melters, noting their capacity to handle 120 tons of snow per hour.

title: Not Drake Maye — just his Raynham, Mass., lookalike
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Tyler Dumas, a 19-year-old from Raynham, Mass., has become locally famous for resembling Patriots quarterback Drake Maye.
Dumas, attending Massasoit Community College, went viral after a TikTok video highlighted his similarity to Maye.
Dumas, a longtime Patriots fan, remains grounded despite the attention and hopes the Patriots win against the Seahawks.
